SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent

Class TEST31_US020703_OrganizerNotifToCancelledUITest

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.TEST31_US020703_OrganizerNotifToCancelledUITest
public class TEST31_US020703_OrganizerNotifToCancelledUITest extends Object
UI tests for US 02.07.03: As an organizer I want to send a notification to all cancelled entrants These instrumented tests verify that:
  • Organizers can access the CancelledListFragment UI
  • The "Send Cancelled List Notification" button is visible and enabled
  • Tapping the button opens a dialog titled "Send Cancelled List Notification"
  • The dialog displays both "OK" and "Cancel" actions
  • The dialog dismisses correctly when "Cancel" is pressed
  • The dialog dismisses correctly when "OK" is pressed (confirming the action)
Note: For reliable test execution, it's recommended to disable animations on the test device/emulator before running these tests: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 0
To re-enable animations after testing: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 1
Note: Full end-to-end testing of notification delivery requires:
  • Navigation to CancelledListFragment for a specific event
  • Organizer user authentication
  • Firebase test data and dependency wiring for Organizer
These tests focus on dialog visibility and basic user interactions in the UI layer.

    • navigateToCancelledListFragment

      private boolean navigateToCancelledListFragment()
      Navigates to the CancelledListFragment. This helper assumes that:
      • The app navigates (or can be navigated) to CancelledListFragment
      • fragment_cancelled_list.xml contains a button with id R.id.btn_notification1
      If your actual navigation requires specific clicks (e.g. open event, switch to "Cancelled" tab), you can insert those interactions here before waiting for btn_notification1.
      Returns:
      true if the fragment appears, false otherwise.

    • organizer_cancelledList_dialogDismissesOnOk

      public void organizer_cancelledList_dialogDismissesOnOk()
      Test Case 5: Dialog dismisses when "OK" is pressed.

      This simulates confirming the notification send. The actual call to Organizer.sendWaitingListNotification(com.example.chicksevent.enums.EntrantStatus, String) is not asserted here; that behaviour is covered at the unit-test level.
